examples.title: FOILing Perfect Squares
examples.problem_text: Which of the following is equivalent to (2x + 3)² + 4x?
examples.answer_explanation:
FOIL the perfect square first, then add 4x.

Step 1: Expand (2x + 3)²
(2x + 3)² = (2x + 3)(2x + 3)
F: 2x · 2x = 4x²
O: 2x · 3 = 6x
I: 3 · 2x = 6x
L: 3 · 3 = 9
Result: 4x² + 12x + 9

Step 2: Add 4x
4x² + 12x + 9 + 4x = 4x² + 16x + 9

Common mistake: (2x + 3)² ≠ 4x² + 9. You MUST FOIL!

The answer is A.

examples.title: Finding Sum of Roots
examples.problem_text: What is the sum of the roots of the polynomial f(x) = x² - 11x + 18?
examples.answer_explanation:
Find roots by factoring, then add them.

Step 1: Set equal to zero
x² - 11x + 18 = 0

Step 2: Factor
Need two numbers that multiply to 18 and add to -11
Those numbers are -2 and -9
(x - 2)(x - 9) = 0

Step 3: Set each factor to zero
x - 2 = 0 → x = 2
x - 9 = 0 → x = 9

Step 4: Sum the roots
2 + 9 = 11

Remember: roots = solutions = zeros = x-intercepts (all the same thing!)

The answer is D.

examples.title: Using Quadratic Formula
examples.problem_text: Which of the following is a zero for the function f(x) = x² - 8x + 4?
examples.answer_explanation:
Use quadratic formula since this does not factor easily.

Formula: x = (-b ± √(b² - 4ac)) / (2a)
For x² - 8x + 4: a = 1, b = -8, c = 4

Step 1: Plug in values
x = (8 ± √(64 - 16)) / 2

Step 2: Simplify under radical
x = (8 ± √48) / 2

Step 3: Simplify √48 = √(16·3) = 4√3
x = (8 ± 4√3) / 2

Step 4: Divide all terms by 2
x = 4 ± 2√3

Both solutions: x = 4 + 2√3 and x = 4 - 2√3

The answer is C.

examples.title: Using the Discriminant
examples.problem_text: How many real roots are there to the equation 2x² - 7x + 9 = 0?
examples.answer_explanation:
Use the discriminant to determine number of real solutions.

Discriminant: b² - 4ac
For 2x² - 7x + 9: a = 2, b = -7, c = 9

Step 1: Calculate discriminant
b² - 4ac = (-7)² - 4(2)(9)
= 49 - 72
= -23

Step 2: Interpret result
Since -23 < 0 (negative), there are 0 real roots

Discriminant Rules:
• Positive → 2 real solutions
• Zero → 1 real solution
• Negative → 0 real solutions (2 complex)

The answer is A.
